channel.title: [PI] Object Delay
channel.description: So I made a donator only object, when you click it it gives some crystals.. they sell for 400k ea and i want know how do i make it so theres a delay before clicking again. For example on the thieveing stalls you have to wait before you can thieve again. How can i make this work with my object?

item.title: [PI] Object Delay
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

dvp999:

bump.

You still need this???
Declare “Gather”

case 4928: if((c.playerLevel[14] < 70) && (c.playerLevel[8] < 88) && System.currentTimeMillis() - c.Gather < 2500) { c.sendMessage("You need 70 Mining And 88 Woodcutting to gather crystals!"); } else { if((c.playerLevel[14] > 69) && (c.playerLevel[8] >87) && System.currentTimeMillis() - c.Gather < 2500) { c.startAnimation(915); c.getItems().addItem(6645, 1); c.Gather = System.currentTimeMillis(); c.sendMessage("You Gather some Valuable Crystals!"); } } break;

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Object Delay
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:14, topic:408370”][quote author=ExtremeX-Scape™ link=topic=509654.msg3697877#msg3697877 date=1312561913]

Well its in the donator zone so… um i dont think how normal players would get there thats how i thought of it.
I didn’t know adding a time for an object would be so complicated.

It’s not. It’s only 3 steps. Also, a player can edit the client to send a packet saying that they interacted with the donator object, even if they’re on the opposite side of the map.

Stop confusing him
He’s going to die because of you!
[/quote]

I’m not confusing him, and he isn’t going to die.

I’m merely informing him about the possible abuse to be encountered unless he takes precautionary measures now.[/quote]

You sure?
I think he’s pretty confused.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Object Delay
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“dvp999, post:7, topic:408370”]o.O What? ^
Sorry but I’ve never coded this sort of thing before ;D :o

Btw heres my code in actionhandler.java

[code] case 4928:
if((c.playerLevel[14] < 70) && (c.playerLevel[8] < 88)) {
c.sendMessage(“You need 70 Mining And 88 Woodcutting to gather crystals!”);
} else {
if((c.playerLevel[14] < 70) && (c.playerLevel[8] < 88)) {
c.sendMessage(“You need 70 Mining And 88 Woodcutting to gather crystals!”);
} else {
if((c.playerLevel[14] < 70) && (c.playerLevel[8] < 88)) {
c.sendMessage(“You need 70 Mining And 88 Woodcutting to gather crystals!”);
} else {
if((c.playerLevel[14] > 69) && (c.playerLevel[8] >87)) {
c.startAnimation(915);
c.getItems().addItem(6645, 1);
c.sendMessage(“You Gather some Valuable Crystals!”);
}
}
}
}

	break;[/code]

Do i need to change anything at all?[/quote]

Yes you do. In fact, you don’t do any sort of checking to see if the player is a donator or not.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Object Delay
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

  1. Declare a variable in the player class (or preferably a sort of SessionDetails class)
  2. In the packet handler, under the case for the “special” object, add a check to see if a certain period of time has passed
  3. If it has, process the packet, set the old time to the new time and break; if not, then you can either ignore the packet, or tell the player that they need to wait.

That’s pretty much all there is to it.

Read full topic

Next time look at Thieving.java.

if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastThieve < 2500) return;
That’s an example.
